Refusing to forget the Alamo (as if anyone could), Houston led the military in Texas' rebellion against Mexico. G.D. Spradlin co-stars as President Andrew Jackson, with Michael Beck appearing as Jim Bowie, James Stephens as Stephen Austin, and Richard Yniguez as Mexican General Santa Anna. Lensed on location in the Lone Star state, this sweeping made-for-TV film originally occupied three hours' screen time on November 22, 1986. Its title at that time was Houston: The Legend of Texas. ~ Hal Erickson, Rovi","popularity":6.439,"poster_path":"/sqOnNiYrnMP6i2nFE7lzjm7zBEJ.jpg","release_date":"1986-11-22","title":"Houston: The Legend of Texas","video":false,"vote_average":7.0,"vote_count":7},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":null,"genre_ids":[37],"id":1186750,"original_language":"en","original_title":"Chance/Trail of the Apache","overview":"A renegade Englishman known as “The White Apache” tangles with brutal scalp hunters who fear no man!
